intro: Didymocarpus forrestii, commonly known as the Yunnan tamarind, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
